noun.description: A large number of similar things or events appearing or occurring in quick succession.
examples: a spate of attacks on travelers

noun.description: A sudden flood in a river, especially one caused by heavy rains or melting snow.

phrases: Many of the local rivers were in spate especially the Owveg River.
Should the river be swollen in spate, it is one of the best places in Scotland to witness the true magic of the spectacular leaping antics of the genuine wild Atlantic salmon.
Mr Gupta said heavy rainfall and rivers in spate had caused several areas to become inundated with water.
Not long ago, one used to spot plaques in many parts of the city, depicting the highest flood level of the river in spate.
origin: Late Middle English (originally Scots and northern English in the sense flood, inundation): of unknown origin.
